Reviews.Title: Won't be buying an HTC again.
Reviews.Author: k "KB"
Reviews.Content: The phone was plagued with issues from the start. And then right at about 10 months, the phone s*** the bed. I called HTC and told them that performance was taking a nose-dive, the battery lasted half a day with regular use, and the phone would drop cell service all the time. Their solution? They mailed me a new SIM card holder... are you kidding me? What a joke. They jerked me around until I hit 12 months, and I went over the warranty period.Problems with this phone include but not limited to:* Freezing. Apps crash often. The HTC UI will crash too. I'll go to the home screen and the UI will take 30 seconds to return.* HORRIBLE battery life. I have to charge the phone twice a day, and sometimes three.* Drops cell service consistently. Too, friends have 4 bars with AT&T; while I consistently have 1 or 2 less.* No removable battery. Really? This is just a gimmick to earn money from users needing battery replacements.* No expandable storage.* The most free memory (RAM) I can ever get is around 150MB. The rest of the 1GB is spent on the OS and HTC background apps. * This thing gets HOT. If it weren't for the Otterbox, you wouldn't be able to hold it comfortably.* HORRIBLE support from HTC. They had zero interest in solving my problem.I'll be buying a different brand as soon as I can. This phone needs to be taken out back and shot.

Reviews.Title: maybe the worst phone i ever owned
Reviews.Author: D. O'Donnell
Reviews.Content: Anyone who tells you HTC's are superior is a moron. ---First, there is no way this should be running the most recent version of android; the number of background processes means you ar perpetually around 100 megs of ram free.- there is no hot button to get to a task manager, so if your phone hangs, you are stuck til it wants to catch up.-you can't pull the case apart and take out the battery, so if it really freezes you are just screwed-no way to add an SD card-can't toggle WiFi, Bluetooth etc from drop down menu-takes around 3-4 touches to adjust brightness, so good luck compensating for glare-no keyboard options aside from language-literally NO WAY to type an acute accent mark by itself on this phone, so god forbid you have any in your user names or passwords-options for application associations are extremely limited (youtube links open in web browser instead of application.In conclusion: Dear HTC, stop making phones because you suck at it
